column2: App that shares lists with roommates

An app that would allow you to input ingredients you had at home into it,and then it would provide you a list of recipes you could make with those ingredients
Item s that are not used extremely often in recipes would have a QR code on the back of them that when scanned would provide a list of simple recipes to make with the leftovers

By dedicating a small section of a grocery store to clustering together seasonal meal ingredients, novice chefs with limited imaginations can learn new things.

column3: An application that gives you reheating instructions based on the type and age of the leftovers.
A specialized, reusable produce transportation pallets that protect fragile produce from damage during transportation between stores.
Optimize current waste-to-energy technology to power grocery stores
A compost bin that is completely contained and designed to travel in cars, be used on camping trips and even at festival grounds.
A portable food waste to energy converter for national parks and other outdoor events
An application that will alert harvesters to fruit or vegetables growing in backyards or other urban areas. Harvesters will arrive, harvest the produce and take it to local stores or food banks.
A smart kitchen that keeps track of the water, energy, food and plastics then creates tips for reducing waste or reuse it productively
column4: How to put food waste to good use

column3: It is smart to take home leftovers if you actually eat them, otherwise you're wasting food and a to-go box. If restaurants could turn their food waste into a to-go box they could save on the price of boxes. Since they're made of food waste, the box would start to degrade if left too long, encouraging people to eat their leftovers.
column4: How to put food waste to good use

column3: Smart Tupperware keeps track of your leftovers and reminds you how much longer you have until the contents go bad.

column2: Self or single-serve leafy greens at supermarkets
column3: Allow people to bring their own Tupperware and get the amount of leafy greens that they actually need. Reduces packaging waste and food waste from over-purchasing
App that connects you with people near by that want similar foods as you but, like you, wont eat a whole grocery store-sized item.
App that connects hungry people with people near by that cooked too much food. Sell your excess meal and either drop it off or have someone pick it up.

Custom garden kits to grow your own fresh ingredients for your famorite meals. Just pick a theme and tell the service how much space you have and let it set up an optimal garden organization scheme and deliver all the plants you need.
An app that takes a photo of a moldy piece of food and tells you if you can still eat the food and, if so, how much to remov.
Teach millennial or novice chefs how to cook for themselves at a grocery store so they can also learn where the ingredients are and what they look like at the store.
A sticker that you put on unripened fruits and vegitables after purchasing them. When the sticker changes color, it's time to put the item into the fridge to maintain its freshness.
A device that tells you the use-by date by analyzing the odors of the food
This arduino-driven LCD will have a list of foods in the fridge. They will be ordered by date entered to remind users to use food before it expires.

This website will track food waste between farms and supermarkets to help farmers adjust outputs. Suggested quantities for the consumer demand of food type will be given per season to reduce unused food.

The labels for the containers will be bio-reactive, with a change in color when food inside starts to degrade. This allows households to more accurately ascertain the freshness of their leftovers, so fresh food is not mistakenly thrown away.

Damaged but still edible fruit that would have been discarded can be juiced and dehydrated to create juice concentrates. This will not be easier than throwing away fruit but should pay for itself in the future.

column3: Shelfs will be installed in commonly frequented public places: parks, parking lots, etc. Allows for quick, convenient drop off of leftover food that can be reused by others. Shelf would not be used for perishable food.

column3: Most food waste in lbs year is wasted on the consumer level. This community fridge is off grid, can store food, and will scan personal cards for prizes won when a certain amount of food in lbs is donated.

column3: The app will work to track the amount, type, and price of food that is wasted in a household, so households can more intelligently buy and consume food.

column3: An app or program will charge extra if people do not finish food at plate. For those that do finish, they will receive a dollar coupon for the next visit

column2: Using Data science to control food production

The neighborhood-compost will collect how much weight is donated by a specific person. Once a ton of food donated is achieved, the donater will receive a rebate from a company.

column3: Grocery stores tend to sell products in large packaged quantities. This device will sit in a grocery store and will sell Vegetables and Dairy, and discounts will accrue from using reusable containers. People will pay less for larger quantities. Product prices will decrease from removing packaging.
A modular and stackable organizer will be placed in the fridge to allow easier access to food. The system should help visual accounting of any food in the fridge.

Retail stores approximately contribute to 10% of the food waste in America. These shelves would be designed to be air tight and in a cool place; instead of throwing food in the trash, the store would place them there. The Emerson act protects the store from lawsuits due to food poisoning. Shelfs will sit above trashcans, and will store food for about 4 days before automatically dropping food in the trash can.

To target food insecure and homeless individuals, this website will have local houses post food items they are about to throw out that is still edible. The goal is to avoid using an app since those in need will most likely not have a smartphone. Consumers would contact and pick up the produce either through direct or indirect means.
column4: What to do with food that is going to be wasted

column3: This app is a database of knowledge and techniques around the world that optimizes the life span of a food and presents how to test if food is still edible. The app will present topics such as appropriate portion sizes, food purchasing skills, meal planning, using leftovers, what is safe to eat, food discard behavior and interpreting sell-by or use-by dates. One goal is to remove dependence on expiration sell by dates to reduce food disposal.EX. Freezing bread to keep it for long, easy to thaw.

To optimize shelf life, these reusable packets will minimize oxygen availability to microbes present on food products and will be for fridge storage. There will be various sizes, each which are meant to represent on meal portion. One packet per meal.
The product will use a food dehydrator to store food for shipment or home use. Enzymes of food decay will be inhibited.

The product is a promotion targeting an increase in sales of damaged produce. The signs will be minimal and visually-attracting that says something like: Find a unique apple and get a 25 cent discount. If successful, farmers may be able ship damaged produce for profit.

column2: First-Class Ticket for Foods Frequently Damaged in Transport
column3: The product will use low-cost methods to reduce food spoilage from farm-to-retail transportation. The device will use heat transfer principles to reduce temperature of the environment and will also reduce moisture in air.

column2: Retail-Tax on Foods with High Waste Rates
column3: The store feature will charge extra on foods that are commonly wasted to encourage better cooking and food usage habits.

column2: 3rd Party Facilitating Joint-Business Plan for Farmers and Retail
column3: The plan will connect retailers and suppliers to develop joint business plansê to drive their supply chain operations with open and honest sharing of information

This app will have users input their favorite fruits and vegetables. Then boxes with contents described will be offered to users based on food choice. Once enough people accept and pay for the box, the box will be shipped from the farm to the consumer.

column3: This product will use recycled and light material to prevent brushing and damage to food products during shipment.
This app will have experiment and experience results pertaining to freezing food and when how to thaw before eating. The goal is to optimize shelf life of food.

Microbes on organic matter have significant activity drop in pH values below 6. Lemon, with a pH of 4, combined with water to create a lemon-vapor environment in shipping containers to postpone decomposition.

A smart weekly schedule board that can be used to organize daily menu selection, which can also be linked to smart phones (iphone, android, etc). In each box, people can write their meal name and list all the ingredients needed. This way, it will prevent people from buying more than needed when food shopping

The app does fresh product deliveries daily or at shorter intervals to make food shopping more accurate. It allows people to choose their desired meal options, the portions needed (e.g. for 3 people), as well as the exact date for consumption. Then, all the ingredients for the chosen meal will be prepared and delivered to the house according to the date of consumption. This app can also scan the E-Menu Planner, import the data, and deliver all the listed ingredients.

The Food bus will go around a certain neighborhood and collect unconsumed food products (that are still good) from households. Then, it will redirect all the donated food products to low-income community, homeless people, and retirement home. This way, people who are aware of food waste problem will actually make a meaningful impact by helping the hungry communities.

column3: The bin consists of three different sections: the top bin will hold the soil and the worms along with the food scraps, the middle part will capture the worm casting (compost), and the bottom bin will collect and store the compost. Worms are good at recycling food scraps and other organic material into a valuable soil amendment called vermicompost.

column3: Creating a sachet bag filled with certain fruit or vegetable seeds so that people can create their own DIY garden. By growing out their own ingredient, people can just use the •rightê amount of it and the plant will keep the fruit vegetable stay fresh. When there are excess vegetables and fruits, they can also give it to other people or donate it. This way, it will create a closed-loop food cycle

column3: Organizing a weekly market that only sells ugly produce products collected from supermarkets with the cheapest price. The location should be put near low-income community or homeless people neighborhood. This way, all ugly food will be consumed instead of getting wasted.

column3: Free-Nom Together is a weekly event where volunteers collect ugly food produce and cook it into delicious meals for all communities with no charge (free). Each Friday, 10 volunteers will collect all the ugly food produce from different places. On Saturday, 15-20 volunteers will cook the ingredients and serve it to others.

column3: Weekly activity that will help to feed thousands of families around the bay area. Volunteers can sort out unconsumed donated food products and SF Food Bank will deliver them to different communities. This is the best way to do meaningful action for those who are aware of food waste issues

Accurate machine learning models capable of recoqnizing different food products and detecting their qualities. Thus, by installing it within the fridge, it can tell which product is about to go bad and that it should be consumed immediately.
This app is inspired from Singaporean most-downloaded app. The system will inform all users about about the discounted menu items from nearby restaurants and food stalls before they close.

Similar to the Food Track App, it can track and monitor food waste. However, this app can also give suggestions or alternative solutions to reduce waste and save money

This app allows users to post certain food products that people want to get rid of, including the quantity, location, and expiry date. Then the app will link the post to other users that might be interested in exchanging food products.

column3: Most of vegetables and fruits often go bad during the transport process. Thus, this app helps truck drivers to find the most efficient route to the delivery points.
Inspired from the UK robotic project to reduce food waste, the robotic chef can move pans, handle ingredients and create greater precision during food manufacturing at industrial scale.
Detachable cameras for the fridge interior, which enable users to observe exactly what food they have left for tonightês dinner via the Home Connect app

The fly larvae are fed organic waste and convert 95% into complex fats and proteins, thus these flies will create both animal feed and fertilizer in –a cheap, scalable and sustainable manners with multiple applications
